intro: Sida gaudichaudiana, commonly known as the velvetleaf or Hawaiian sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant characterized by its smooth, often hairy stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow to green flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fibrous roots and robust growth make it adaptable to various soil types. Sida gaudichaudiana is also noted for its potential use in traditional medicine and as a source of natural fibers.
